Summary: star distant object crossed sky,(90 deg.) came to stop, shot straight up out of sight.
divs: sighting detailsat my rural friend's house enjoying an outdoor camp fire with my wife, child, and friends, and looking into distant clear night summer sky, (zero clouds) about 50 degrees upward and in the western sky, several of us (6-8 people)saw what appeared to be star-like distant "light" similar to what a star looks like unmagnified; except it appeared to cross the entire panoramic sky 90 degees from direct west to direct north. and, at an upward distance appearing about the same distance as the stars, though it likely wasn't i'd guess. this took only about 40 seconds for this "lighted object" to cross all the way from west to north a full 90 degrees. as the night was clear as a bell, and the nearest town is a half hour drive away, let's just say there were no optical distortions in the way of viewing what we all viewed. as i appeared to notice the object first, i called everyone's attention to this bizarre sight\light and said, "what the fuck is that"??? the distance was obviously far too high for any satellite, plane, etc. we guessed, and the speed was simply astonishing. the meteoric speed is what caught our\my attention to the object in the first place. however, meteors do not come to a decidedly zig-zaggy tailed dead stop, then change direction 90 degrees to "straight up", then proceed to rise higher yet into the sky at astonishing (non-earthly acceleration and inertial moment of torque displayed) speed, and straight up out of complete visual sight. i have never seen anything remotely like this in my lifetime, and may never again. but you could not now tell me there are not unexplainable objects traversing our skies! as i am my own best witness, and generally believe nothing of what i hear, maybe half of what i read, and generally all of what i see with my decidedly mechanical engineering eyes, you could not convince me that any earth designed object has control of its field effects similar to the object we saw. obviously, we had wished it would have been close enough to make out any details of the object. (which we could not) basically just a bright far light from where we were. think though; at the distance this was at, and the ability to go 90 degrees in the short time elapsed, means this object at it's height of travel, had to travel likely several thousand miles to achieve the angled trajectory of 90 degree radial travel in the time\distance covered at the height observed. it would take quite a craft to achieve this. i would guess anyone with this level of technology, has the ability to control their phase relationship to eath's gravitational force and "simply" manipulate the phase angle and field effects to their own advantage for omnidirectional propulsion purposes. this would also explain the craft "silence" many seem to indicate in their respective sightings. i've never been much into scoping out any ufo possibilities, but also have no reason not to assume they are not only real, but far advanced compared to to our meager low tech existance. it would stand to reason. unless some are so indignant they believe themselves to own the universe? hardly i'd guess. our experience was the most unusual physics event i've ever witnessed personally. i don't convince easily either. had i not witnessed this myself, i simply would hold out room for another explanation. certainly not what i\we witnessed!! dan
